DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of severe aplastic anemia classification.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Life-threatening anemia associated with a high risk of infection or bleeding._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Life-threatening anemia associated with a high risk of infection or bleeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Life-threatening anemia associated with a high risk of infection or bleeding._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare genetic disorder characterized by nail dystrophy, reticulated skin pigmentation especially on the neck and chest, and oral leukoplakia.  In about half the cases mutations in the TERT, TERC, DKC1, or TINF2 genes are identified.  Patients are at an increased risk of developing bone marrow failure, myelodysplastic syndrome, leukemia, or cancer, especially in the head and neck region.

Concepts.definition: A rare genetic disorder characterized by nail dystrophy, reticulated skin pigmentation especially on the neck and chest, and oral leukoplakia.  In about half the cases mutations in the TERT, TERC, DKC1, or TINF2 genes are identified.  Patients are at an increased risk of developing bone marrow failure, myelodysplastic syndrome, leukemia, or cancer, especially in the head and neck region.

PermissibleValues.value: Acquired severe aplastic anemia, not otherwise specified
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Acquired Severe Aplastic Anemia Not Otherwise Specified

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Acquired Severe Aplastic Anemia Not Otherwise Specified
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to a medical condition or characteristic that is not present at birth and develops subsequently.: Life-threatening anemia associated with a high risk of infection or bleeding.: Not characterized in any other way.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to a medical condition or characteristic that is not present at birth but develops subsequently.
Life-threatening anemia associated with a high risk of infection or bleeding.
Not characterized in any other way.

PermissibleValues.value: Acquired SAA secondary to toxin / other drug

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to a medical condition or characteristic that is not present at birth and develops subsequently.: A state of bone marrow suppression and failure that is caused by a cytotoxic or adverse immunologic response to a drug treatment, leading to a failure of production of red blood cells, white cells and platelets.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to a medical condition or characteristic that is not present at birth but develops subsequently.

A state of bone marrow suppression and failure that is caused by a cytotoxic or adverse immunologic response to a drug treatment, leading to a failure of production of red blood cells, white cells and platelets.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Acquired Aplastic Anemia due to Hepatitis

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Acquired Aplastic Anemia due to Hepatitis
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to a medical condition or characteristic that is not present at birth and develops subsequently.: Bone marrow failure defined as pancytopenia, secondary to hepatitis.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to a medical condition or characteristic that is not present at birth but develops subsequently.
Bone marrow failure defined as pancytopenia, secondary to hepatitis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to a medical condition or characteristic that is not present at birth and develops subsequently.: A non-neoplastic, congenital or non-congenital disorder charcaterized by marked reduction or absence of megakaryocytes and thrombocytopenia.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to a medical condition or characteristic that is not present at birth but develops subsequently.
A non-neoplastic, congenital or non-congenital disorder charcaterized by marked reduction or absence of megakaryocytes and thrombocytopenia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Of or relating to a medical condition or characteristic that is not present at birth and develops subsequently.: A reduction in the number of blood cells.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Of or relating to a medical condition or characteristic that is not present at birth but develops subsequently.
A laboratory test result indicating an abnormally low quantity of circulating blood cells.

PermissibleValues.value: Acquired pure red cell aplasia (not congenital)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disease characterized by normocytic, normochromic anemia, low hematocrit, reticulocytopenia and selective erythroid hypoplasia. It can occur as a chronic or acute form; the former is predominantly seen in adults and the latter in children.  Pathogenesis involves immune dysfunction with antibodies directed against erythroid precursor cells or erythropoietin, or due to T-cell mediated suppression of erythropoiesis.

Concepts.definition: A disease characterized by normocytic, normochromic anemia, low hematocrit, reticulocytopenia and selective erythroid hypoplasia. It can occur as a chronic or acute form; the former is predominantly seen in adults and the latter in children. Pathogenesis involves immune dysfunction with antibodies directed against erythroid precursor cells or erythropoietin, or due to T-cell mediated suppression of erythropoiesis.
